sentences.english: Hopefully he’ll bring the Planet of the Apes series back to life.
sentences.chinese: 希望导演能让《人猿星球》系列重获新生。

sentences.english: Love is blind but marriage is an eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 爱情让人盲目，而婚姻则让人重获光明。

sentences.english: Hatred paralyzes life; love release it.
sentences.chinese: 恨使生活瘫痪无力，爱使他重获新生。

sentences.english: The priest could not reveal her confidences.
sentences.chinese: 牧师的启示不能使她重获信心。

sentences.english: My people and all of outland shall be free.
sentences.chinese: 我的人民与整个外域将重获自由。

sentences.english: Hate got me into prison, love is goanna break me out.
sentences.chinese: 仇恨使我进了监狱，爱将使我重获自由。

sentences.english: As we get older, we work feverishly to recapture our youth.
sentences.chinese: 随着我们年纪越来越大，我们狂热地工作以重获青春。

sentences.english: This is the Word of God that sets you free.
sentences.chinese: 这是使你重获自由的上主圣言。

sentences.english: After the Battle of Endor, the Wookiees were finally afforded their freedoms.
sentences.chinese: 恩多战役以后，伍基人渡尽劫波，重获自由。

sentences.english: Know it will pass, and strength you will gain.
sentences.chinese: 相信苦难定会过去，你将重获力量。

sentences.english: You have a life to live and one direction to go in - ahead.
sentences.chinese: 眼下的生活正在继续，而你已重获新的方向继续前行。

sentences.english: Her son later regained an interest in reading and has a Ph.D.
sentences.chinese: 她的儿子不久又重获阅读的兴趣并获得了博士学位。

sentences.english: Vacations help us regain that sense of spontaneity and self-expression.
sentences.chinese: 假期有助我们重获油然而生的感觉和自我表达的感觉。

sentences.english: People say that Erratics may be rewarmed steeping in songs by Dido .
sentences.chinese: 他们说，漂泊的人可以在蒂朵的歌声中重获温暖。

sentences.english: We can recover our personal freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我们能重获我们的个人自由。

sentences.english: This will make demesne opportunity of survival of video website recovery.
sentences.chinese: 这将使私有视频网站重获生气。

definition: to pick up (a theme etc)/to regain (confidence)/to revive (a custom, friendship etc)
to reinstate/to resume/to restore/to recover/to regain/to rehabilitate
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
able to/so that sb can/enabling/in order to/finally in a position to/with sth in view
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
